instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Have two board with exactly same issue. stack at 5V and 0.10Amps. No water damage, no previous problem. 

I was checking other topics. Seems that some of this models with T2 may be firmware issue. So i can see that there is a way to restore it for MBP 2018 but cant find same for MBA 2019.  Anyone can help me?

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: Do you get any voltages on the board?

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Yes:
PBUS , PPBUS_HS_CPU 12,3V
PPDCIN_G3H-5V
PP5V_G3S - 0V (P5VG3S_EN -0V) and PP5V_S5_LDO also 0. is that ok?
PP3V3_G3H_RTC 3.2V
PP3V3_G3H 3.2V




ALL_SYS_PWRGD -0V

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Looks like T2 firmware corruption.
No S5 voltage comes on usually.

Compare your values with these:
"U7800 SYM 1 of 4:
PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU = 3.37V
PP1V1_SLPS2R = 1.1V
PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X = 3.37V
PP0V8_SLPS2R = 0.8V
PP3V0_G3H_RTC = 3.0V
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.2V
CPU_C10_GATE_L = 0V
PP1V05_S0SW = 0V
LDO_RTC = 1.5V
PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU = 3.37V
PP3V3_AWAKE = 3.37V
PP3V3_S5 = 0V"
extracted from this thread
[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/55802-820-01041-stuck-at-5v[/url]

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: Yes seems to be t2 corruption. Anything to do with this shit board or throw it away? Is there any way to restore this firmware like mbp but for mba?

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: Should be the same method, no matters which model machine is.

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: i am trying it with macbook 12 and when plug it says: Cannot Use Thunderbols accesory. Thunderbolt accessories are not supported on this Mac. Any idea? Must try with mbp? dont have one now here.

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
I think someone reported that not any cable serves.
Maybe 12" machine doesn't serve, or the cable is not compatible.
Also be sure to find the correct USB-C port for DFU recovery.

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: i am using apple oficial cable. Is it ok?

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: Try other cable, I remember people reported problems with Apple cables.

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message: there is no way to put this fu...ing machine in dFU mode like apple's site instruction tell us. also using apple official thunderbolt it says that it's not compatible. Anyone had succes with mba 2018-2019???

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
I have had success using apples USB-C charging cable only on the 2018 A1989 MBP. I tried the same cable on two different 2018 A1990's and got the same error you are getting about "Cannot Use Thunderbolt accessory". I ended up having to buy apple's Thunderbolt 3 cable (With the lightning bolt symbol on the connectors) and then I was able to get both of my A1990's into DFU mode. [URL="https://www.apple.com/shop/product/MQ4H2AM/A/thunderbolt-3-usb%E2%80%91c-cable-08-m"]https://www.apple.com/shop/product/M...91c-cable-08-m[/URL] 

Also, apple's instructions says to hold the keys for 3 seconds but I found that holding them for 7 seconds works better.

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
threads.message:
Thanks for this post man.
This will really help other people to solve the f***g DFU problems...

threads.title: 820-01521-a stuck at 5V.
